review_text:
If you need a place to stay for a month or far less, this is a good spot. The door is immediately met by carpet, be sure to use a sturdy push to get the door open. You’ll be accompanied by a loud bang from the screen door if you don’t gently close it yourself. There was a bit of a pest problem, I don’t think it has anything to do with the Host but more so the town itself. I was bitten by spiders and saw rodents scrambling across the kitchen floor to go underneath the appliances, they even got into the cupboards.
Since I wasn’t notified beforehand, trash goes out on Tuesday if you’re staying for longer than a few days. Loved the shower, loved the comfiness of the bed, loved the fact there’s a washer and drier. A bit of a tight space if you’re taller than 5”6-8. The stay was alright and I’m not saying anything to discourage anyone, just honesty and a fair warning if you do happen to encounter some things mentioned.

We loved the house, it is newly updated and they really have considered everything with their stocking of the kitchen, laundry room, and linens-- lots of unexpected extras that made our stay with a family of 5 easy and comfortable.
Beds were comfy, the king bed was great even for side and stomach sleepers. Great pillows, too.
The kitchen was fully stocked, and we got to enjoy cooking and sharing a meal with family we were visiting (the first time 4 generations were together in 10 years!). We cook a lot when we travel and have never had a nicer, better stocked kitchen in an Airbnb, so that's a huge plus in my books!
The hosts were great at communicating, contactless check-in was a breeze, house rules and expectations were clear. It's located in what seems a pretty quiet, family oriented neighborhood walkable to Washburn Park and an easy drive to Gage Park where we went to the holiday Zoo Lights event.
The only caution for future guests is that the varnish smell from the renovations (at the time of our stay) was still pretty noticeable and could be bothersome to anyone sensitive to VOCs. We were able to open windows and run the ceiling fans in the bedrooms to help air it out and it didn't detract from our stay.
We would definitely stay here again!
